intro: Asemeia hondurana, commonly known as the Honduran asemeia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. It has palmate leaves and produces capsules as its fruit type. Asemeia hondurana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
